meanings.definition: The state or quality of being first in time, order, or importance.
meanings.sent1: In the race, her firstnesses allowed her to cross the finish line before anyone else.
meanings.sent2: His firstnesses in the class made him the leader of the group project.
meanings.sent3: The firstnesses of the alarm clock woke him up with a start every morning.
meanings.sent4: Her firstnesses in the family made her the go-to person for advice and support.
meanings.sent5: The firstnesses of the sun rising every day is a reminder of new beginnings.

meanings.definition: The act of being the first to do or experience something.
meanings.sent1: His firstnesses in trying the new food surprised his friends.
meanings.sent2: She always enjoyed the firstnesses of exploring a new city.
meanings.sent3: The firstnesses of tasting ice cream for the first time brought a big smile to his face.
meanings.sent4: Their firstnesses in skydiving together created a bond that would last a lifetime.
meanings.sent5: The firstnesses of a baby's first steps are a joyous moment for parents.
